text: Bill Simpson (March 14, 1940 â€“ December 16, 2019) was an American racecar driver and businessman. He was best known as a key figure in the racing safety business with his company Simpson Performance Products. He left Simpson Performance in a controversy surrounding Dale Earnhardt's death. He was added into the Motorsports Hall of Fame of America in 2003.Bill Simpson at the Motorsports Hall of Fame of America He was the author of the book Racing Safely, Living Dangerously, and its sequel, Through the Fire.
